message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) category as it deals with action recognition and dynamic scene recognition using spatiotemporal representations. It also involves the use of convolutional neural networks (CNN's) which are commonly used in computer vision tasks. 

The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques, specifically deep learning, which makes it likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. 

The paper proposes a novel approach to combining 2D- and 3D-CNN's, which involves the use of hallucination as an auxiliary task. This makes it likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category. 

The paper deals with video analysis and processing, which makes it likely to belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category. 

Finally, the paper involves the use of neural networks to optimize performance, which makes it likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) category.
